tweets.text: @Jane45665825 @RosieP4 @H_S_E @EnvAgency @FewsLane Here's a very brief introduction to the circumstances in which investigation of contamination in connection with development is required. https://t.co/5cSysa2sAY

@Jane45665825 @RosieP4 @H_S_E @EnvAgency @FewsLane Ultimately it's the land owner who is responsible, though the developer may also be. Councils may end up footing the bill on "orphan" sites. But remediation is only compulsory in certain very limited circumstances, including conditions imposed on planning consents.

Maybe the @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA can explain yesterday why 6 miles away in #kidsgrove you could smell Walleys Quarry? 

You are the regulator and experts, so it's only fair to ask you for the answers & solutions? There is no doubt that smell has got wider.

@StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off there is one thing really irritating about the whole of our campaign , we aren’t asking for money , fame or anything other than clean fresh air and still we get ignored by the authorities and people who are from round here . #stopthestink

tweets.text:
I've heard the @EnvAgency are surprised NGOs are refusing to work with them.

Why?

The River Avon catchment is comprised of 5 chalk streams protected as SSSI and SAC. In 2020 @wessexwater spent 26,916 hours dumping sewage into the river.

https://t.co/zslGdsV3lC

@SianieRoo @PHE_EoEngland God! What! It makes my blood boil reading story after story from all over the country. Children are so precious & this nonsense has got to stop. Who are your new councillors?

@RedIndustries2 need to be punished for what they are doing but @EnvAgencyMids are scared that they will leave the site orphaned, All the while the people of Newcastle under Lyme are still being gassed. You're going to pay for this. #stopthestink #capitoff

@wonkotsane @SFRS_cjackson @SFRS_GWilliams @shropsfire @TelfordWrekin @BBCShropshire @EnvAgency @bbcmtd They are fire fighters not weathermen, they do not control atmospheric conditions. They are doing everything in their power to control the situation, but they can not control the weather.

UPDATE 8/5/21 from @SFRS_GWilliams 
We are expecting the smoke plume to increase and decrease through the day due to activities. This will be monitored by partners for air quality and also the impacts on the M54. @shropsfire @TelfordWrekin @BBCShropshire @EnvAgency @bbcmtd https://t.co/cgI2GeY57u
